flawed_nl_solution:
If it was 10 degrees hotter on this day in Miami than in New York, then the temperature in Miami was 80+10 = 90 degrees.
If it was 25 degrees cooler in Miami than in San Diego, then the temperature in San Diego was 90+25 = <<90+25=151>>151 degrees.
The total temperature for all the cities is 151+90+80 = <<151+90+80=321>>321 degrees
The average temperature of the three cities is 321/3 = <<321/3=107>>107 degrees
#### 107

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 115, not 151. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
